body.title: Configuration file overview
body.p: The SPFE configuration file is the core of the SPFE build system. It defines the XML elements that specify the content to include in the documentation set and the scripts to process the content to generate the output. You can use a single configuration file for the documentation set; however, unless you have a very simple documentation set, it is best to divide the configuration elements into a main configuration file and separate configuration files for each topic set. You can use an include element to import other configuration files. This enables you to maximize reuse and modularity. The set of configuration files makes up the complete set of elements that the build system needs to build the documentation set.

SPFE provides the spfe-config.xsd schema. You can define your own schema, which can include the spfe-config.xsd schema and you can add elements that are specific to your documentation set. Each configuration file used to build the documentation set must follow the same schema.

Items that apply to the entire documentation set should be specified in the main configuration file (the file specified as a parameter when you run the spfe build tool). You can override the value of elements as needed in other configuration files.
The following elements must be defined in the main configuration file:

li.p: /spfe: This is the root element of the configuration file; each configuration file must specify this element.
/spfe/doc-set: If you use a documentation set, you must define the element here.

body.p: You may want to specify the following elements in the main configuration file:

li.p: /spfe/topic-type-aliases: If you want to use a user-friendly name for a topic set in the table of contents, and you have multiple topic sets that use the same topic schema, it is a good idea to specify this element in the main configuration file. The value of the /spfe/topic-aliases/topic-type/alias attribute appears in the table of contents for the documentation set.

/spfe/wip-site: If you want to make a documentation set under development available for for internal viewing, specify the appropriate chilld element values for your test site You need to modify the synthesis scripts to use this feature of SPFE.

/spfe/scripts and /spfe/sources: To avoid duplication, if one or more topic sets use the same scripts or use content from the same locations, it is best to specify them in the main configuration file.
/spfe/output-formats: Specify this element in the main configuration file if all toipic-sets support the same output formats.
/spfe/style/html-output-directories: The style sheets to format HTML output. There should be an overall style sheet and individual topic sets can specify this element to add additional directories.
